channel.title: Sort an Enum by different values
channel.description:
So I have an enum set up like so:
[code=java] ONE(int, int, "string"), TWO(int, int, "string"), //etc [/code]
However, the integers are not constant, only the string is. Would there be a way to sort the enum by either integer?

item.title: Sort an Enum by different values
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:5, topic:546978”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=665876.msg4451596#msg4451596 date=1411850789]
If you have to sort an enum you are probably using it incorrectly. Can you tell us what you are using it for?
[/quote]

You’re right David, I was. This was for one of 2 projects I’m working on (this one not being a rsps) and I was trying to rank non-user “opponents” by their score, and for some reason the best idea I could come up with was an enum.

The enum was like so:

BOB(score, id, "name") [/quote]Ah, yes. Enums are pretty much always used to store constant values. The two main ways to think of them are either as symbols (when its literally just a name, like in other languages) or as constant instances of a class you define (in cases where you add variables and methods

for example a comparison would be like

[code=java]
enum Instrument {
TROMBONE(“53d”),
CLARINET(“42b”),
FLUTE(“32f”);

private final String wut;

private Instrument(String wut) {
this.wut = wut;
}

public String upDaButt() {
return wut;
}
}[/code]

is similar to:

[code=java]

public class Instrument {
public static final Instrument TROMBONE = new Instrument(“53d”);
public static final Instrument CLARINET = new Instrument(“42b”);
public static final Instrument FLUTE = new Instrument(“32f”);

private final String wut;

public Instrument(String wut) {
this.wut = wut;
}

public String getDaWut() {
return wut;
}
}[/code]
The enum is cleaner in this case, and the way it stores the instances is better.

There are instances where sometimes the values wont be always final and you use them and maybe modify them once, but for the most part don’t consider them to be something you want to mutate.

Read full topic
item.source: Sort an Enum by different values

item.title: Sort an Enum by different values
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:6, topic:546978”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=665876.msg4452147#msg4452147 date=1412295248]

If you have to sort an enum you are probably using it incorrectly. Can you tell us what you are using it for?

You’re right David, I was. This was for one of 2 projects I’m working on (this one not being a rsps) and I was trying to rank non-user “opponents” by their score, and for some reason the best idea I could come up with was an enum.

The enum was like so:

BOB(score, id, "name")

[/quote]
abort that right now, thats not what enums are for[/quote]

Yes I know that now, and I did a while ago. Thank you.

Read full topic
